alert.note: Alert for Charles (Maryland) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Baltimore/Washington (Washington D.C., Central Maryland, Northern Virginia, Eastern West Virginia)
info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 27 at 7:51PM EDT until May 27 at 8:30PM EDT by NWS Baltimore/Washington
info.description: The National Weather Service in Sterling Virginia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Central Charles County in southern Maryland... * Until 830 PM EDT. * At 751 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Nanjemoy Creek, moving northeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Damaging winds will cause some trees and large branches to fall. This could injure those outdoors, as well as damage homes and vehicles. Roadways may become blocked by downed trees. Localized power outages are possible. Unsecured light objects may become projectiles. * Locations impacted include... Waldorf, La Plata, Port Tobacco River, Popes Creek, Saint Charles, Wicomico, Hughesville, Aquasco, Bryantown, Pomfret, Port Tobacco Village, Dentsville, Port Tobacco, White Plains, Bel Alton, Newburg, Northwood, Welcome and Faulkner. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
